Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2012 06:18PM Pkate wrote: I got a lot of courage yesterday after completing treatment and having my final surgery so took a new picture to display! First one of my new and growing hair.  A little sore today but so glad its over.  So many hugs and congrats yesterday from a wonderful team of cancer caregivers.
Posts.Title: Summer 2012 RADS HANG OUT Stacie rgina

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2012 03:27PM Pkate wrote: Hey ladies, I am one day away from finishing my rads.  I had 31 regular treatements and 8 boosts.  I'll walk over to outpatient surgery to get my port out in the afternoon. Been quite a ride these last nine months but couldn't have made it without you. Trish
Posts.Title: Summer 2012 RADS HANG OUT Stacie rgina

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2012 06:52PM Pkate wrote:  Thank you Catherine for starting this group.  I get my first chemo on 4/4/12 with labs/echo/mo visit the day before along with new pt orientation on Monday.  WIth Neulasta on Thursday, that's a week's worth of visits.  I went to see the Rad Onc today and had a blood pressure of 168/90!!  Its been like that since I had my first biopsy.  The day before the biopsy it was 120/70.  I'm gathering its anxiety which i've never had before.  Has anyone else experienced this?  I wake up every night with my heart pounding out of my chest and can't get back to sleep.  My brain is understanding al of this process but it seems my body doesn't want to comply! Also, is anyone else taking a steroid (decadron) the day before and Ativan for nausea as needed? Pkate in MD
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2012 04:05PM Pkate wrote: I just had a lumpectomy 3 weeks ago and stil have pain that just stops me from doing anything.  Its an achy pain above the breast (incision was beneath and lump was at 9 o'clock).  I've been told its the nerves growing back.  I also get chills quite often now even when I'm under the covers which cause more ache.  I've been checked by the surgeon and the two oncologists so no infection.  I thought by now the pain would be gone as it has with other surgeries I've had.  I going for a second surgery, re-excision in two weeks so at least I know what to expect.
Posts.Title: PAIN MANAGEMENT barbiecorn barbiecorn
